articles.title: Americans Are Flush With Cash and Jobs. They Also Think the Economy Is Awful. - The New York Times
articles.description: The psychological effects of inflation seem to have the upper hand.
articles.content: But that follows years of relatively low inflation; the index has averaged only 2.8 percent a year over the last three years. And higher prices have arrived at the same time probably not coincidental… [+1692 chars]
